QuickstartLinks.Title: Barracuda Web Application Firewall with Backend IIS Servers
QuickstartLinks.Description: This Azure quickstart template deploys a Barracuda Web Application Firewall Solution on Azure with required number of backend Windows 2012 based IIS Web Servers.Templates includes latest Barracuda WAF with Pay as you go license and latest Windows 2012 R2 Azure Image for IIS.The Barracuda Web Application Firewall inspects inbound web traffic and blocks SQL injections, Cross-Site Scripting, malware uploads & application DDoS and other attacks targeted at your web applications. One External LB is deployed with NAT rules to enable Remote desktop access to backend web servers. Please follow post deployment configuration guide available in GitHub template directory to learn more about post deployment steps related to Barracuda web application firewall and web applications publishing.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Multi-client VNS3 network appliance
QuickstartLinks.Description: VNS3 is a software only virtual appliance that provides the combined features and functions of a Security Appliance, Application Delivery Controller and Unified Threat Management device at the cloud application edge. Key benefits, On top of cloud networking, Always on end to end encryption, Federate data centres, cloud regions, cloud providers, and/or containers, creating one unified address space, Attestable control over encryption keys, Meshed network manageable at scale, Reliable HA in the Cloud, Isolate sensitive applications (fast low cost Network Segmentation), Segmentation within applications, Analysis of all data in motion in the cloud. Key network functions; virtual router, switch, firewall, vpn concentrator, multicast distributor, with plugins for WAF, NIDS, Caching, Proxy Load Balancers and other Layer 4 thru 7 network functions, VNS3 doesn't require new knowledge or training to implement, so you can integrate with existing network equipment.

QuickstartLinks.Title: VNS3 network appliance for cloud connectivity and security
QuickstartLinks.Description: VNS3 is a software only virtual appliance that provides the combined features and functions of a security appliance, application delivery controller and unified threat management device at the cloud application edge. Key benefits, on top of cloud networking, always on end to end encryption, federate data centres, cloud regions, cloud providers, and/or containers, creating one unified address space, attestable control over encryption keys, meshed network manageable at scale, reliable HA in the cloud, isolate sensitive applications (fast low cost Network Segmentation), segmentation within applications, Analysis of all data in motion in the cloud. Key network functions; virtual router, switch, firewall, vpn concentrator, multicast distributor, with plugins for WAF, NIDS, caching, proxy, load balancers and other layer 4 thru 7 network functions, VNS3 doesn't require new knowledge or training to implement, so you can integrate with existing network equipment.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Concourse CI
QuickstartLinks.Description: Concourse is a CI system composed of simple tools and ideas. It can express entire pipelines, integrating with arbitrary resources, or it can be used to execute one-off tasks, either locally or in another CI system. This template can help to prepare neccessary Azure resources to setup such a CI system, and make the setup more simple.

Atlas is provided by Hashicorp (makers of Consul) as a way to quickly create Consul clusters without having to manually join each node

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy IOMAD cluster on Ubuntu
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys IOMAD as a LAMP application on Ubuntu. It creates a one or more Ubuntu VM for the front end and a single VM for the backend. It does a silent install of Apache and PHP on the front end VM's and MySQL on the backend VM. Then it deploys IOMAD on the cluster. It configures a load balancer for directing requests to the front end VM's. It also configures NAT rules to allow admin access to each of the VM's. It also sets up a moodledata data directory using file storage shared among the VM's. After the deployment is successful, you can go to /iomad on each frontend VM (using web admin access) to start configuring IOMAD.

By orchestrating deployment of those containers using Kubernetes in Azure Container Service, you can achieve replicable, manageable clusters of containers. By setting up a continuous build to produce your container images and orchestration, you can increase the speed and reliability of your deployment.

QuickstartLinks.Title: NetApp ONTAP Cloud with SQL
QuickstartLinks.Description: NetApp ONTAP Cloud, the leading enterprise storage operating system, is deployed using OnCommand Cloud Manager to deliver secure, proven NFS, CIFS and iSCSI data management for Azure cloud storage. A software-only storage service running the ONTAP storage operating system, ONTAP Cloud combines data control with enterprise-class storage features—such as data deduplication and compression—to minimize your Azure storage footprint. OnCommand Cloud Manager handles deployment and management of ONTAP Cloud, giving you a simple point-and-click environment to manage your storage and ease control of your data. This Quickstart deploys a production ready and secure environment which includes NetApp ONTAP Cloud, OnCommand Manager, backend SQL Server and Jump Server for accessing systems via remote Desktop.It follows standard recommended architecture & security best practices. See quickstart guide at http://bit.ly/otcguide before deploying the template.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Azure Cloud Shell - VNet storage
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys Azure Cloud Shell storage into an Azure virtual network.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Azure Cloud Shell - VNet
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys Azure Cloud Shell resources into an Azure virtual network.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create an HPC cluster
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates an HPC cluster with the latest version of HPC Pack 2012 R2. The head node with local HPC databases acts as domain controller as well.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Custom Private DNS Zone
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template shows how to deploy a customer private DNS zone within your virtual network.  It enables dynamic DNS updates and reverse DNS and gives scripts to configure both Windows and Linux clients to use the custom DNS zone name as the DNS suffix and to perform dynamic DNS updates to maintain the DNS records in the custom zone.

QuickstartLinks.Title: DDoS attack on a virtual machine
QuickstartLinks.Description: This will deploy a virtual machine, OMS and other network resources. Perform the DDoS attack by following the guidleines and execute the scenario for detection of a DDoS attack.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a DevTest environment with P2S VPN and IIS
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a simple DevTest environment with a Point-to-Site VPN and IIS on a Windows server which is a great way to get started.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create Ubuntu vm data disk raid0
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a virtual machine with multiple disks attached.  A script partitions and formats the disks in raid0 array.

QuickstartLinks.Title: DMZ with NSG
QuickstartLinks.Description: This example will create a simple DMZ with four windows servers, a VNet with two subnets, and a Network Security Group.

QuickstartLinks.Title: DNS Forwarder VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template shows how to create a DNS server that forwards queries to Azure's internal DNS servers.  This is useful for setting up DNS resultion between virtual networks (as described in https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-networks-name-resolution-for-vms-and-role-instances/).

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a DNS Zone with the correct records for Office 365
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template configures the records needed to integrate Azure DNS with Office 365 by adding the correct CNAME, SRV, MX, and TXT records.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy an Ubuntu VM with Docker Engine & Rancher
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy an Ubuntu VM with Docker (using the Docker Extension). In addition, the Rancher Server (or agent) will be deployed.

QuickstartLinks.Title: IIS Server using DSC extension on a Windows VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Windows VM and sets up an IIS server using the DSC extension. Note, the DSC configuration module needs a SAS token to be passed in if you are using Azure Storage. For DSC module link from GitHub (default in this template), this is not needed.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Simple DSC Pull Server
QuickstartLinks.Description: This example allows to you deploy a powershell desired state configuration pull server.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Dynamic Web Test Creation
QuickstartLinks.Description: Create any number of App Insights web (ping) tests.

QuickstartLinks.Title: eShop Website with ILB ASE
QuickstartLinks.Description: An App Service Environment is a Premium service plan option of Azure App Service that provides a fully isolated and dedicated environment for securely running Azure App Service apps at high scale, including Web Apps, Mobile Apps, and API Apps.

QuickstartLinks.Title: ESET VM Extension
QuickstartLinks.Description: Creates a VM with ESET extension

QuickstartLinks.Title: Redundant haproxy with Azure load-balancer and floating IP
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a redundant haproxy setup with 2 Ubuntu VMs configured behind Azure load balancer with floating IP enabled. Each of the Ubuntu VMs run haproxy to load balance requests to other application VMs (running Apache in this case). Keepalived enables redundancy for the haproxy VMs by assigning the floating IP to the MASTER and blocking the load-balancer probe on the BACKUP. This template also deploys a Storage Account, Virtual Network, Public IP address, Network Interfaces.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create HDInsight Linux Cluster and run a script action
QuickstartLinks.Description: Template creates an HDInsight Linux cluster in a virtual network and then runs a custom script action on every node and sets environment var.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Hub and Spoke topology sandbox
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a basic hub-and-spoke topology setup. It creates a Hub VNet with subnets DMZ, Management, Shared and Gateway (optionally), with two Spoke VNets (development and production) containing a workload subnet each. It also deploys a Windows Jump-Host on the Management subnet of the HUB, and establishes VNet peerings between the Hub and the two spokes.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a sample logic app, to use as Entitlement Management custom extensions
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a simple logic app with all the authorization policy settings and schema to http trigger that is needed by Entitlement Management custom extension API.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a sample logic app, to use as Entitlement Management custom extensions
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a simple logic app with all the authorization policy settings, service now connetion to create tickets and schema to http trigger that is needed by Entitlement Management custom extension API.

QuickstartLinks.Title: IIS VMs & SQL Server 2014 VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: Create 1 or 2 IIS Windows 2012 R2 Web Servers and one back end SQL Server 2014 in VNET.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Azure Image Builder with Azure Windows Baseline
QuickstartLinks.Description: Creates an Azure Image Builder environment and builds a Windows Server image with the latest Windows Updates and Azure Windows Baseline applied.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Integration Patterns - Message Router - Logic App
QuickstartLinks.Description: Solution which shows how we can set up the Message Router pattern using a Logic App

QuickstartLinks.Title: Integration Patterns - Message Router - Service Bus
QuickstartLinks.Description: Solution which shows how we can set up the Message Router pattern using a Service Bus Topic

QuickstartLinks.Title: IPv6 in Azure Virtual Network (VNET) with Std LB
QuickstartLinks.Description: Create a dual stack IPv4/IPv6 VNET with 2 VMs and an Internet-facing Standard Load Balancer.

QuickstartLinks.Title: VMSS deploy of IPv6 in Azure Virtual Network (VNET)
QuickstartLinks.Description: Create VM Scale Set with dual stack IPv4/IPv6 VNET and Std Load Balancer.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Kubernetes cluster with VMSS Cluster Autoscaler
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a vanilla kubernetes cluster initialized using kubeadm. It deploys a configured master node with a cluster autoscaler. A pre-configured Virtual Machine Scale Set (VMSS) is also deployed and automatically attached to the cluster. The cluster autoscaler can then automatically scale up/down the cluster depending on the workload of the cluster.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a LAMP app
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template uses the Azure Linux CustomScript extension to deploy an application. It creates an Ubuntu VM, does a silent install of MySQL, Apache and PHP, then creates a simple PHP script.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Public Load Balancer chained to a Gateway Load Balancer
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Public Standard Load Balancer chained to a Gateway Load Balancer. The traffic incoming from internet is routed to the Gateway Load Balancer with linux VMs (NVAs) in the backend pool.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Azure managed disk performance meter
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to run a managed disk performance test for different workload types using fio utility.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Azure managed disk RAID performance meter
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to run a managed disk RAID performance test for different workload types using fio utility.

QuickstartLinks.Title: McAfee Endpoint Security (trial license) on Windows VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Windows VM and sets up a trial version of McAfee Endpoint Security

QuickstartLinks.Title: Memcached service cluster using multiple Ubuntu VMs
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates one or more memcached services on Ubuntu 14.04 VMs in a private subnet. It also creates one publicly accessible Apache VM with a PHP test page to confirm that memcached is installed and accessible.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a new action groupn on Azure

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Service Health Alert
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple alert which uses an action group to send email notifications for any Service Health records in the Azure Activity Log

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys an Azure Resource Graph shared query. The shared query counts all virtual machine resources and summarizes by the OS type. A shared query can be pinned to a dashboard or converted to a supported visualization such as a bar or pie chart.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy the Sports Analytics on Azure Architecture
QuickstartLinks.Description: Creates an Azure storage account with ADLS Gen 2 enabled, an Azure Data Factory instance with linked services for the storage account (an the Azure SQL Database if deployed), and an Azure Databricks instance. The AAD identity for the user deploying the template and the managed identity for the ADF instance will be granted the Storage Blob Data Contributor role on the storage account. There are also options to deploy an Azure Key Vault instance, an Azure SQL Database, and an Azure Event Hub (for streaming use cases). When an Azure Key Vault is deployed, the data factory managed identity and the AAD identity for the user deploying the template will be granted the Key Vault Secrets User role.

QuickstartLinks.Title: SQL Server AlwaysOn Cluster with Managed Disks in AZ

In the case there are multiple VHD files compressed in a single ZIP and you got the URL to fetch the ZIP archive, this ARM template will ease the job: Download, Extract and Import into an existing Storage Account Blob Container.

QuickstartLinks.Title: 1 VM in vNet - Multiple data disks

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy Net Disk against Ubuntu
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows deploying seafile server 6.1.1 on Azure Ubuntu VM

QuickstartLinks.Title: Azure sysbench CPU performance meter
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to run a CPU performance test using sysbench utility.

QuickstartLinks.Title: VM Using Managed Identity for Artifact Download

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template installs a certificate from Azure Key Vault on a Virtual Machine and opens up WinRM HTTP and HTTPS listeners. Prerequisite: A certificate uploaded to Azure Key Vault. Create the Key Vault using the template at http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/templates/101-create-key-vault

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploys Windows VMs under LB,configures WinRM Https

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Windows VM and configures WinRM https listener
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Windows VM using a few different options for the Windows version. This will then configure a WinRM https listener. User need to provide the value of parameter 'hostNameScriptArgument' which is the fqdn of the VM. Example: testvm.westus.cloupdapp.azure.com or *.westus.cloupdapp.azure.com

QuickstartLinks.Title: VMAccess extension on a Ubuntu VM

This template also deploys a jumpbox with a public IP address in the same virtual network. You can connect to the jumpbox via this public IP address, then connect from there to VMs in the scale set via private IP addresses.

It can be used for an Enterprise Agreement billing mode only.  The official documentation shows modifications needed for other types of accounts.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy Anbox Cloud
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys Anbox Cloud on an Ubuntu VM. Completing the installation of Anbox Cloud requires user interaction following the deployment; please consult the README for instructions. The template supports both launching of a VM from an Ubuntu Pro image and association of an Ubuntu Pro token with a VM launched from a non-Pro image. The former is the default behaviour; users seeking to attach a token to a VM launched from a non-Pro image must override the default arguments for the ubuntuImageOffer, ubuntuImageSKU, and ubuntuProToken parameters. The template is also parametric in the VM size and disk sizes. Non-default argument values for these parameters must comply with https://anbox-cloud.io/docs/reference/requirements#anbox-cloud-appliance-4.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create an Azure Analysis Services server using a template

QuickstartLinks.Title: Basic Agent Setup Identity
QuickstartLinks.Description: This set of templates demonstrates how to set up Azure AI Agent Service with the basic setup using managed identity authetication for the AI Service/AOAI connection. Agents use multi-tenant search and storage resources fully managed by Microsoft. You won’t have visibility or control over these underlying Azure resources.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Basic Agent Setup API Keys
QuickstartLinks.Description: This set of templates demonstrates how to set up Azure AI Agent Service with the basic setup using API keys authetication for the AI Service/AOAI connection. Agents use multi-tenant search and storage resources fully managed by Microsoft. You won’t have visibility or control over these underlying Azure resources.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Network Secured Agent with User Managed Identity
QuickstartLinks.Description: This set of templates demonstrates how to set up Azure AI Agent Service with virtual network isolation using User Managed Identity authetication for the AI Service/AOAI connection and private network links to connect the agent to your secure data.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Standard Agent Setup
QuickstartLinks.Description: This set of templates demonstrates how to set up Azure AI Agent Service with the standard setup, meaning with managed identity authentication for project/hub connections and public internet access enabled. Agents use customer-owned, single-tenant search and storage resources. With this setup, you have full control and visibility over these resources, but you will incur costs based on your usage.

QuickstartLinks.Description: This templates creates an alert rule and user assigned MSI. It also assigns the MSI reader access to the subscription so that the alert rule has access to query the required protected items and latest recovery point details.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with parameters
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with parameterized configuration settings

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with custom origin
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with a user specified origin and all of our most commonly used settings on CDN.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a CDN Endpoint with cache override through Rules
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with a user specified origin and all of our most commonly used settings on CDN. This template also configures rules engine with a path based rule and overrides cache expiration.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a CDN Endpoint with response header addition
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with a user specified origin and all of our most commonly used settings on CDN. This template also configures rules engine with Remote address based match and adds corresponding response headers.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a CDN Endpoint with rewrite and redirect rules
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with a user specified origin and all of our most commonly used settings on CDN. This template also configures rules engine device based path rewrite and request scheme based redirect.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a CDN Endpoint with UrlSigning action
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with a user specified origin and all of our most commonly used settings on CDN. This template also configures rules engine UrlSigning action for default and override parameters.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a CDN Profile, Endpoint and a Storage Account
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with origin as a Storage Account. Note that user needs to create a public container in the Storage Account in order for CDN Endpoint to serve content from the Storage Account.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Apply a WAF Policy with custom rules to a CDN Endpoint
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with a user specified origin and all of our most commonly used settings on CDN. This template also links a CDN WAF Policy to the Endpoint which applies example custom rules for blocking and redirecting requests based on geo-location, ip address, and SESSIONID header.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Apply a WAF Policy for the OWASP top 10 to a CDN Endpoint
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with a user specified origin and all of our most commonly used settings on CDN. This template also links a CDN WAF Policy to the Endpoint which applies the managed rule set DefaultRuleSet_1.0.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Apply a WAF Policy with rate limit rules to a CDN Endpoint
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with a user specified origin and all of our most commonly used settings on CDN. This template also links a CDN WAF Policy to the Endpoint which applies example rate limit rules for blocking and redirecting rate-limited requests.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a CDN Profile, a CDN Endpoint and a Web App
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a CDN Profile and a CDN Endpoint with a Web App as the origin

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a custom domain and customer-managed certificate.

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a custom domain and Microsoft-managed certificate.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium with Azure Functions origin
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium, an Azure Functions app, and configures the function app to validate that traffic has come through the Front Door origin.

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a web application firewall with a geo-filtering rule.

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a web application firewall with a rate limit rule.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium with rule set
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a rule set.

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door with origins, routes and ruleSets, and an Azure Storage accounts with blob containers. Front Door sends traffic to the storage accounts when uploading files.

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium and an Azure Storage static website, and configured Front Door to send traffic to the static website.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium with WAF and custom rule
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a web application firewall with a custom rule.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a VM with multiple NICs and RDP accessible
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a Virtual Machines with multiple (2) network interfaces (NICs), and RDP connectable with a configured load balancer and an inbound NAT rule. More NICs can easily  be added with this template. This template also deploys a Storage Account, Virtual Network, Public IP address, and 2 Network Interfaces (front-end and back-end).

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create 2 Virtual Machines in a VNET and under an internal Load balancer and configure a load balancing rule on Port 80. This template also deploys a Storage Account, Virtual Network, Public IP address, Availability Set and Network Interfaces.

QuickstartLinks.Title: 2 VMs in a Load Balancer and load balancing rules
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create 2 Virtual Machines under a Load balancer and configure a load balancing rule on Port 80. This template also deploys a Storage Account, Virtual Network, Public IP address, Availability Set and Network Interfaces. In this template, we use the resource loops capability to create the network interfaces and virtual machines

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create 2 Virtual Machines in an Availability Set and configure NAT rules through the load balancer. This template also deploys a Storage Account, Virtual Network, Public IP address and Network Interfaces. In this template, we use the resource loops capability to create the network interfaces and virtual machines

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create and encrypt a new Linux VMSS with jumpbox
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a Linux VMSS using the latest Linux image, adds data volumes, and then encrypts the data volumes of each Linux VMSS instance.  It also deploys a jumpbox with a public IP address in the same virtual network as the Linux VMSS instances with private IP addresses.  This allows connecting to the jumpbox via its public IP address, and then connecting to the Linux VMSS instances via private IP addresses.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create and encrypt a new Windows VMSS with jumpbox
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM Scale Set of Windows VMs using the lastest patched version of serveral Windows versions. This template also deploys a jumpbox with a public IP address in the same virtual network. You can connect to the jumpbox via this public IP address, then connect from there to VMs in the scale set via private IP addresses.This template enables encryption on the VM Scale Set of Windows VMs.

QuickstartLinks.Title: GlassFish on SUSE
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a load balanced GlassFish (v3 or v4) cluster, consisting of a user defined number of SUSE (OpenSUSE or SLES) VMs.

QuickstartLinks.Title: List Storage Account keys-Windows Custom Script extension
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Windows Server 2012 R2 VM and runs a PowerShell script using the custom script extension. It also uses the listKeys function to get the Azure Storage Account keys. The PowerShell script for this sample must be hosted in an Azure Storage account. (Note: For other samples custom script can also be hosted in GitHub)

QuickstartLinks.Title: VMs in Availability Zones with a Load Balancer and NAT
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create Virtual Machines distributed across Availability Zones with a Load Balancer and configure NAT rules through the load balancer. This template also deploys a Virtual Network, Public IP address and Network Interfaces. In this template, we use the resource loops capability to create the network interfaces and virtual machines

QuickstartLinks.Title: Virtual Machine Scaleset example using Availability Zones
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a VMSS placed in separate Availability Zones with a load balancer.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy multiple VM Scale Sets of Linux VMs
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy multiple VM Scale Sets of Linux VMs.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy multiple VM Scale Sets of Windows VMs
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy multiple VM Scale Sets of Windows VMs.

QuickstartLinks.Title: OS Patching extension on a Ubuntu VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Ubuntu VM and installs the OSPatching extension

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Premium Windows VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Premium Windows VM using a few different options for the Windows version, using the latest patched version.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a Azure Compute Gallery
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a Azure Compute Gallery.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create an Image Definition in a Azure Compute Gallery
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a simple Image Definition in a Azure Compute Gallery. Please ensure that you have run the Shared Image Gallery 101 Template before you deploy this.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create an Image Version in a Azure Compute Gallery
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a simple Image Version in a Azure Compute Gallery. Please ensure that you have run the Azure Compute Gallery 101 Template and the Image Definition 101 Template before you deploy this.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Creates an ultra managed disk with a specific sector size
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a new ultra managed disk allowing the user to specify a sector size of either 512 or 4096.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a simple Linux VM and update private IP to static
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Linux VM using Ubuntu from the marketplace. This will deploy a VNET, Subnet, and an A1 size VM in the resource group location with a dynamically assigned IP address and then convert it to static IP.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create VMs in Availability Sets using Resource Loops
QuickstartLinks.Description: Create 2-5 VMs in Availability Sets using Resource Loops.  The VMs can be Unbuntu or Windows with a maximum of 5 VMs since this sample uses a single storageAccount

QuickstartLinks.Title: Multi VM Template with Managed Disk
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template will create N number of VM's with managed disks, public IPs and network interfaces. It will create the VMs in a single Availability Set. They will be provisioned in a Virtual Network which will also be created as part of the deployment

QuickstartLinks.Title: Use output from a Custom Script Extension during Deployment
QuickstartLinks.Description: This is useful to the VM's compute to perform some task during deployment that Azure Resource Manager does not provide.  The output of that compute (script) can then be leveraged elsewhere in the deployment.  This is useful if the compute resource is needed in the deployment (e.g. a jumpbox, DC, etc), a bit wasteful if it is not.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Install a file on a Windows VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Windows VM and run a custom PowerShell script to install a file on that VM.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Virtual Machine with Custom Data
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a Virtual Machine with Custom Data passed down to the VM. This template also deploys a Storage Account, Virtual Network, Public IP addresses and a Network Interface.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Azure Dedicated Hosts
QuickstartLinks.Description: This will deploy an isolated environment using Azure Dedicated Hosts for you to provision VMs.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Premium Windows VM with diagnostics
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Premium Windows VM using a few different options for the Windows version, using the latest patched version.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a VM in a VNET in different Resource Group
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a VM in a VNET which is in a different Resource Group

QuickstartLinks.Title: Joins an existing Windows VM to AD Domain
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to join an already exitsing Windows virtual machine into an existing Active Directory Domain. For this template to work you need an existing virtual machine, an AD Domain and a Domain Controller that has communication with this virtual machine and DNS settings that will allow this virtual machine to resolve the Domain DNS name.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Join a VM to an existing domain
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template demonstrates domain join to a private AD domain up in cloud.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a VM with a dynamic selection of data disks
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows the user to select the number of data disks they'd like to add to the VM.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a VM from a EfficientIP VHD
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a VM from a EfficientIP VHD and let you connect it to an existing VNET that can reside in another Resource Group then the virtual machine

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a VM from User Image
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a Virtual Machines from a User image. This template also deploys a Virtual Network, Public IP addresses and a Network Interface.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a VM in a new or existing vnet from a generalized VHD
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a VM from a generalized VHD and let you connect it to a new or existing VNET that can reside in another Resource Group than the virtual machine

QuickstartLinks.Title: CentOS/UbuntuServer Auto Dynamic Disks & Docker 1.12(cs)
QuickstartLinks.Description: This is a common template for creating single instance CentOS 7.2/7.1/6.5 or Ubuntu Server 16.04.0-LTS with configurable number of data disks (configurable sizes). Maximum 16 disks can be mentioned in the portal parameters and maximum size of each disk should be less than 1023 GB. The MDADM RAID0 Array is automounted and survives restarts. Latest Docker 1.12(cs3) (Swarm), docker-compose 1.9.0 & docker-machine 0.8.2 is available for usage from user azure-cli is auto running as a docker container. This single instance template is an offshoot of the HPC/GPU Clusters Template @ https://github.com/azurebigcompute/BigComputeBench

QuickstartLinks.Title: GitLab Omnibus
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template simplifies the deployment of GitLab Omnibus on a Virtual Machine with a public DNS, leveraging the public IP's DNS. It utilizes the Standard_F8s_v2 instance size, which aligns with reference architecture and supports up to 1000 users (20 RPS). The instance is pre-configured to use HTTPS with a Let's Encrypt certificate for secure connections.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Linux VM with Serial Output
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a simple Linux VM with minimal parameters and serial/console configured to output to storage

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a simple Windows VM with monitoring and diagnostics
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Windows VM along with the diagnostics extension which enables monitoring and diagnostics for the VM

QuickstartLinks.Title: Terraform on Azure
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Terraform workstation as a Linux VM with MSI.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Linux VM with MSI Accessing Storage
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a linux VM with a system assigned managed identity that has access to a storage account in a different resource group.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Linux or Windows VM with MSI
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Linux or Windows VM with a Managed Service Identity.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a VM from a Windows Image with 4 Empty Data Disks
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a Windows Virtual Machine from a specified image. It also attaches 4 empty data disks. Note that you can specify the size of the empty data disks.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VM with multiple IPs
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a VM with 3 IP configurations. This template will deploy a Linux/Windows VM called *myVM1* with 3 IP configurations: *IPConfig-1*, *IPConfig-2* and *IPConfig-3*, respectively.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Linux VM (Ubuntu) with multiple NICs
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a VNet with multiple subnets and deploys a Ubuntu VM with multiple NICs

QuickstartLinks.Title: Virtual Machine with Conditional Resources
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows deploying a linux VM using new or existing resources for the Virtual Network, Storage and Public IP Address.  It also allows for choosing between SSH and Password authenticate.  The templates uses conditions and logic functions to remove the need for nested deployments.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create VM from existing VHDs and connect it to existingVNET
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a VM from VHDs (OS + data disk) and let you connect it to an existing VNET that can reside in another Resource Group then the virtual machine

QuickstartLinks.Title: Push a certificate onto a Windows VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: Push a certificate onto a Windows VM. Create the Key Vault using the template at http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/templates/101-create-key-vault

QuickstartLinks.Title: Secure VM password with Key Vault
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Windows VM by retrieving the password that is stored in a Key Vault. Therefore the password is never put in plain text in the template parameter file

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a simple FreeBSD VM in resource group location
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple FreeBSD VM using a few different options for the FreeBSD version, using the latest patched version. This will deploy in resource group location on a D1 VM Size.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a simple Linux VM with Accelerated Networking
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Linux VM with Accelerated Networking using Ubuntu version 18.04-LTS with the latest patched version. This will deploy a D3_v2 size VM in the resource group location and return the FQDN of the VM.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a simple Ubuntu Linux VM 20.04-LTS
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys an Ubuntu Server with a few options for the VM. You can provide the VM Name, OS Version, VM size, and admin username and password. As default the VM size is Standard_D2s_v3 and OS version is 20.04-LTS.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux VM (RHEL 7.8 unmanaged)
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template will deploy a Red Hat Enterprise Linux VM (RHEL 7.8), using the Pay-As-You-Go RHEL VM image for the selected version on Standard A1_v2 VM in the location of your chosen resource group with an additional 100 GiB data disk attached to the VM. Additional charges apply to this image - consult Azure VM Pricing page for details.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux VM (RHEL 7.8)
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template will deploy a Red Hat Enterprise Linux VM (RHEL 7.8), using the Pay-As-You-Go RHEL VM image for the selected version on Standard D1 VM in the location of your chosen resource group with an additional 100 GiB data disk attached to the VM. Additional charges apply to this image - consult Azure VM Pricing page for details.

QuickstartLinks.Title: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server VM (SLES 12)
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template will allow you to deploy a SUSE Linux Enterprise Server VM (SLES 12), using the Pay-As-You-Go SLES VM image for the selected version on Standard D1 VM in the location of your chosen resource group with an additional 100 GiB data disk attached to the VM. Additional charges apply to this image - consult Azure VM Pricing page for details.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Windows Server VM with Visual Studio
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a Windows Server VM with Visual Code Studio Community 2019, with a few options for the VM. You can provide the name of VM, the admin username and admin password.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a simple Windows VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Windows VM using a few different options for the Windows version, using the latest patched version. This will deploy an A2 size VM in the resource group location and return the FQDN of the VM.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VM into an Availability Zone
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM (Windows or Ubuntu), using the latest patched version. This will deploy a A2_v2 size VM in the location specified and return the FQDN of the VM.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a VM in a new or existing vnet from a custom VHD
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a VM from a specialized VHD and let you connect it to a new or existing VNET that can reside in another Resource Group than the virtual machine

QuickstartLinks.Title: Existing SQL Server Auto Backup setup
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template setup or update on an existing SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure with the Auto Backup Configuration

QuickstartLinks.Title: Existing SQL Server Auto Patching setup
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template setup or update on an existing SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure with the Auto Patching Configuration

QuickstartLinks.Title: Existing SQL Server credentials setup with Azure Key Vault
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template setup or update on an existing SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure with the credentials secured by Azure Key Vault

QuickstartLinks.Title: SQL Server 2014 SP2 Enterprise with Auto Backup
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template will create a SQL Server 2014 SP2 Enterprise edition with Auto Backup feature enabled

QuickstartLinks.Title: SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise with Auto Patching
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template will create a SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise edition with Auto Patching feature enabled.

QuickstartLinks.Title: SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise with Azure Key Vault
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template will create a SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise edition with Azure Key Vault Integration feature enabled.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Virtual Machine with SSH rsa public key
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a Virtual Machine with SSH rsa public key

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a simple Windows VM with tags
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template will deploy a D2_v3 Windows VM, NIC, Storage Account, Virtual Network, Public IP Address, and Network Security Group. The tag object is created in the variables and will be applied on all resources, where applicable.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a trusted launch capable Linux virtual machine
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a trusted launch capable Linux virtual machine using a few different options for the Linux version, using the latest patched version. If you enable Secureboot and vTPM, the Guest Attestation extension will be installed on your VM. This extension will perform remote [attestation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/information-protection/tpm/tpm-fundamentals#measured-boot-with-support-for-attestation) by the cloud. By default, this will deploy an Standard_D2_v3 size virtual machine in the resource group location and return the FQDN of the virtual machine.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a trusted launch capable Windows virtual machine
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a trusted launch capable Windows virtual machine using a few different options for the Windows version, using the latest patched version. If you enable Secureboot and vTPM, the Guest Attestation extension will be installed on your VM. This extension will perform remote [attestation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/information-protection/tpm/tpm-fundamentals#measured-boot-with-support-for-attestation) by the cloud. By default, this will deploy an Standard_D2_v3 size virtual machine in the resource group location and return the FQDN of the virtual machine.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Virtual Machine with User Data
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a Virtual Machine with User Data passed down to the VM. This template also deploys a Virtual Network, Public IP addresses, and a Network Interface.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Virus attack on Virtual Machines Scenario
QuickstartLinks.Description: This will deploy 2 virtual machines, OMS and other network resources. One virtual machine without endpoint protection and other with enpoint protection installed. Perform the virus attack by following the guidlines and execute the scenario for mitigation and prevention of a virus attack.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Windows VM with Windows Admin Center extension
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Windows VM with Windows Admin Center extension to manage the VM directly from Azure Portal.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Windows VM with Azure secure baseline
QuickstartLinks.Description: The template creates a virtual machine running Windows Server in a new virtual network, with a public IP address. Once the machine has deployed, the guest configuration extension is installed and the Azure secure baseline for Windows Server is applied. If the configuration of the machines drifts, you can re-apply the settings by deploying the template again.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Windows VM with a variable number of data disks
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM and specify the number of data disks at deploy time using a parameter.  Note that the number and size of data disks is bound by the VM size.  The VM size for this sample is Standard_DS4_v2 with a default of 16 data disks.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Windows Server VM with SSH
QuickstartLinks.Description: Deploy a single Windows VM with Open SSH enabled so that you can connect through SSH using key-based authentication.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a data management gateway and install on an Azure VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a virtual machine and creates a workable data management gateway

QuickstartLinks.Title: Virtual machine with an RDP port
QuickstartLinks.Description: Creates a virtual machine and creates a NAT rule for RDP to the VM in load balancer

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a VM with multiple empty StandardSSD_LRS Data Disks
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to create a Windows Virtual Machine from a specified image. It also attaches multiple empty StandardSSD data disks by default. Note that you can specify the size and the Storage type (Standard_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS and Premium_LRS) of the empty data disks.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Self-host Integration Runtime on Azure VMs
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a selfhost integration runtime and registers it on Azure virtual machines

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy VM Scale Set with LB probe and automatic repairs
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a VM scale set of Linux VMs behind a load balancer with health probe configured. The scale set also has automatic instance repairs policy enabled with a grace period of 30 minutes.

QuickstartLinks.Title: VM Scale Set Configuration managed by Azure Automation
QuickstartLinks.Description: Deploy a VM Scale Set where virtual machines are deployed as registered nodes in the Azure Automation Desired State Configuration service, and node configuration is guaranteed consistency after deployment. NOTE: Required prerequisites Registration Key and Registration URL are available only after successful creation of an Azure Automation Account for Azure Automation DSC.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VMSS that connects each VM to an Azure Files share
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys an Ubuntu Virtual Machine Scale Set and uses a custom script extension to connect each VM to an Azure Files share

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Windows VM Scale Set with a Custom Script Extension
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a VM Scale Set of Windows VMs using the lastest patched version of various Windows Versions. These VMs have a custom script extension for customization and are behind a load balancer with NAT rules for rdp connections.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Scale Set into an existing vnet
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a VM Scale Set into an exsisting vnet.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Add multiple VMs into a Virtual Machine Scale Set
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template will create N number of VM's with managed disks, public IPs and network interfaces. It will create the VMs in a Virtual Machine Scale Set in Flexible Orchestration mode. They will be provisioned in a Virtual Network which will also be created as part of the deployment

QuickstartLinks.Title: VMSS Flexible Orchestration Mode Quickstart Linux
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a simple VM Scale Set with instances behind an Azure Load Balancer. The VM Scale set is in Flexible Orchestration Mode. Use the os parameter to choose Linux (Ubuntu) or Windows (Windows Server Datacenter 2019) deployment. NOTE: This quickstart template enables network access to VM management ports (SSH, RDP) from any internet address, and should not be used for production deployments.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VM Scale Set with Linux VMs behind ILB
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a VM Scale Set of Linux VMs using the latest patched version of Ubuntu Linux 15.10 or 14.04.4-LTS. These VMs are behind an internal load balancer with NAT rules for ssh connections.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VM Scale Set with a Linux custom image
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a custom VM Linux image inside an Scale Set. These VMs are behind a load balancer with HTTP load balancing (by default on port 80). The example uses a custom script to do the application deployment and update, you may have to provide your custom script for your own update procedure. You will have to provide a generalized image of your VM in the same subscription and region where you create the VMSS.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VM Scale Set with Linux VMs in Availabilty Zones
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM Scale Set of Linux VMs using the latest patched version of Ubuntu Linux 14.04.4-LTS or 16.04-LTS. These VMs are behind a load balancer with NAT rules for ssh connections.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a simple VM Scale Set with Linux VMs
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM Scale Set of Linux VMs using the latest patched version of Ubuntu Linux 14.04.4-LTS or 16.04-LTS. These VMs are behind a load balancer with NAT rules for ssh connections.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Linux VMSS wth primary/secondary architecture
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Linux VMSS with a Custom Script Extension in primary secondary architecture

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Linux or Windows VMSS with MSI
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Linux or Windows Virtual Machine Scale Set with a Managed Service Identity. That identity is then used to access Azure services.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Simple VM Scale Set with Linux VMs and public IPv4 per VM
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template demonstrates deploying a simple scale set with load balancer, inbound NAT rules, and public IP per VM.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Manually change the number of VMs in a Scale Set
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to manually change the number of VMs in a Scale Set.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a trusted launch capable Windows VM Scale Set
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a trusted launch capable VM Scale Set of Windows VMs using the latest patched version of Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019 or Windows Server 2022 Azure Edition. These VMs are behind a load balancer with NAT rules for RDP connections. If you enable Secureboot and vTPM, the Guest Attestation extension will be installed on your VMSS. This extension will perform remote [attestation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/information-protection/tpm/tpm-fundamentals#measured-boot-with-support-for-attestation) by the cloud.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy an Ubuntu VM scale set with Azure Application Gateway
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Ubuntu VM Scale Set integrated with Azure Application Gateway, and supports up to 1000 VMs

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VM Scale Set with Linux VMs and Auto Scale
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM Scale Set of Linux VMs using the latest patched version of Ubuntu Linux 15.04 or 14.04.4-LTS. These VMs are behind a load balancer with NAT rules for ssh connections.They also have Auto Scale integrated

QuickstartLinks.Title: SSL enabled VM Scale Set
QuickstartLinks.Description: Deploys web servers configures with SSL certificates deployed securely form Azure Key Vault

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Scale Set into an existing vnet on Windows
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a Windows 2016 Datacenter VM Scale Set into an exsisting resource group, vnet and subnet.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a Windows VM scale set with Azure Application Gateway
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Windows VM Scale Set integrated with Azure Application Gateway, and supports up to 1000 VMs

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VM Scale Set with Windows VMs and Auto Scale
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM Scale Set of Windows VMs using the latest patched version of Windows 2008-R2-SP1, 2012-Datacenter, or 2012-R2-Datacenter. These VMs are behind a load balancer with NAT rules for RDP connections. They also have Auto Scale integrated

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VM Scale Set with a Windows custom image
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM Scale Set usng a custom Windows image. These VMs are behind a load balancer with HTTP load balancing (by default on port 80)

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a VM Scale Set with Windows VMs in Availability Zones
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a VM Scale Set of Windows VMs using the lastest patched version of various Windows Versions. These VMs are behind a load balancer with NAT rules for rdp connections.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a simple VM Scale Set with Windows VMs
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM Scale Set of Windows VMs using the lastest patched version of various Windows Versions. These VMs are behind a load balancer with NAT rules for rdp connections.

QuickstartLinks.Description: Template for deploying VMSS with Public IP Prefix

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a Confidential Ledger
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template uses Confidential Ledger to log to an immutable, tamper-proof ledger.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a Budget with Filter
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template shows how to create a budget under a subscription.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a Simple Budget
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template shows how to create a budget under a subscription.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a Budget
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template shows how to create a budget under a subscription.

QuickstartLinks.Description: Deploy a Linux container that has a health probe using Azure Container Instances.

QuickstartLinks.Description: Deploy a single Linux container accessible via a public IP using Azure Container Instances.

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template demonstrates an on-demand SFTP server using an Azure Container Instance (ACI).

QuickstartLinks.Description: Deploy a container instance into an Azure virtual network.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a managed Kubernetes Cluster with AAD (AKS)
QuickstartLinks.Description: This ARM template demonstrates the deployment of an AKS instance with advanced networking features into an existing virtual network and Azure AD Integeration. Additionally, the chosen Service Principal is assigned the Network Contributor role against the subnet that contains the AKS cluster.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy a managed Kubernetes Cluster (AKS)
QuickstartLinks.Description: This ARM template demonstrates the deployment of an AKS instance with advanced networking features into an existing virtual network. Additionally, the chosen Service Principal is assigned the Network Contributor role against the subnet that contains the AKS cluster.

Then you use Azure Managed Grafana's managed private endpoint to connect to this Prometheus server and display the Prometheus data in a Grafana dashboard

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy an Azure Databricks Workspace with all 3 forms of CMK

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a new Datadog - An Azure Native ISV Service resource and a Datadog organization to monitor resources in your subscription.

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a data factory pipeline for a copy activity from Azure Blob into an Azure SQL Database while invoking a stored procedure

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a Data Factory, Blob source, SQL sink and Pipeline
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a data factory pipeline for a copy activity from Azure Blob into an Azure SQL Database

QuickstartLinks.Title: Two-Activity chained Data Factory Pipeline
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template deploys a new Data Factory and requisite objects (linked services, datasets, pipelines, gateways, etc.) to fascilitate a two-activity chained Data Factory pipeline. The first leg of the pipeline leverages data management gateway to pull data from an on-premises SQL server source into Azure Data Lake Store in Apache orc columnar storage format. The second leg of the pipeline pulls data from orc files in Azure Data Lake Store and inserts into Azure SQL as a final destination. This pipeline can be easily customized to accomodated a wide variety of additional sources and targets.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a blob for the data factory copy data tool quickstart
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a blob storage and uploads a file for the copy data tool quickstart

QuickstartLinks.Title: Performs ETL job using Azure services
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template provides an example of how to perform analytics on the historic as well as  real time streaming data  stored in Azure Blob Storage. The data from the event hub is taken by the Azure Stream Analytics Job to perform transformation and the output is stored in Azure Blob Storage and is visualized in PowerBI. The analytics is applied on the historic data stored in Blob storage by Azure Data Analytics and the movement of extracted, transformed and published data and the orchestration is done by Data Factory. The published data is further visualized in PowerBI

QuickstartLinks.Title: Migrate to Azure SQL database using Azure DMS
QuickstartLinks.Description: The Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) is designed to streamline the process of migrating on-premises databases to Azure. DMS will simplify the migration of existing on-premises SQL Server and Oracle databases to Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance or Microsoft SQL Server in an Azure Virtual Machine. This template would deploy an instance of Azure Database Migration service, an Azure VM with SQL server installed on it which will act as a Source server with pre created database on it and a Target Azure SQL DB server which will have a pre-created schema of the database to be migrated from Source to Target server. The template will also deploy the required resources like NIC, vnet etc for supporting the Source VM, DMS service and Target server.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Deploy Azure Database Migration Service (DMS)
QuickstartLinks.Description: Azure Database Migration Service is a fully managed service designed to enable seamless migrations from multiple database sources to Azure data platforms with minimal downtime (online migrations).

QuickstartLinks.Title: Azure Digital Twins with Function and Private Link service
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates an Azure Digital Twins service configured with a Virtual Network connected Azure Function that can communicate through a Private Link Endpoint to Digital Twins. It also creates a Private DNS Zone to allow seamless hostname resolution of the Digital Twins Endpoint from the Virtual Network to the Private Endpoint internal subnet IP address. The hostname is stored as a setting to the Azure Function with name 'ADT_ENDPOINT'.

Data is sent to an event hub which eventually forwards the data to the Azure Data Explorer cluster. Data is stored in a database table in the cluster

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a Standard Stream Analytics Job
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates a Standard Stream Analytics Job. For more information, Azure Stream Analytics is a real-time analytics and complex event-processing engine that is designed to analyze and process high volumes of fast streaming data from multiple sources simultaneously. Patterns and relationships can be identified in information extracted from a number of input sources including devices, sensors, clickstreams, social media feeds, and applications. These patterns can be used to trigger actions and initiate workflows such creating alerts, feeding information to a reporting tool, or storing transformed data for later use. Also, Stream Analytics is available on Azure IoT Edge runtime, and supports the same exact language or syntax as cloud.

QuickstartLinks.Title: Web App with Managed Identity, SQL Server and ΑΙ
QuickstartLinks.Description: Simple example to deploy Azure infrastructure for app + data + managed identity + monitoring

QuickstartLinks.Title: Install Public Certificate in App Service
QuickstartLinks.Description: Install a Public Certificate in App Service. Once a public certificate is installed by deploying this template, it would be accessible to App Service code for consumption. This is supported only on dedicated App Service Plans. If your App Service is hosted on a public scale unit then you can only install certificates in CurrentUser-Personal certificate store. For App Service Environments, LocalMachine-Personal certificate store is also supported

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a web app on Azure with Python enabled

QuickstartLinks.Title: Create a Web App + Redis Cache + SQL DB with a template
QuickstartLinks.Description: This template creates an Azure Web App with Redis cache and a SQL Database.

QuickstartLinks.Description: Create and configure a Windows VM with SQL Azure database, and deploy web application to the environment using PowerShell DSC

QuickstartLinks.Description: Azure Web Apps Monitoring with Azure Log Analytics (OMS)

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template is a subscription level template that will assign a role at subscription scope.

QuickstartLinks.Description: This template is a tenant level template that will assign a role to the provided principal at the tenant scope. The user deploying the template must already have the Owner role assigned at the tenant scope.
